Contributing to ambiR

Source: .github/CONTRIBUTING.md

This is how you can contribute to ambiR. The authors are happy to receive all forms of feedback so that we can maintain and improve the package.

Code of Conduct

By participating, that is by contributing to, or commenting on the ambiR project, you agree to abide by the code of conduct.

Corrections to species list

This concerns errors in the species lists. Examples could include misspelling of a species name or allocation of a species to an incorrect AMBI group.

If you find such an issue, what should you do?

The preferred place to register such an issue is in the ambiR GitHub repository. You should first check if the issue has already been raised by someone else.

https://github.com/NIVA-Denmark/ambiR/issues?q=label:“Species%20data”

You do not need to be a registered GitHub user to view existing issues. If you want so submit a new issue, you will need to register as a user.

Please remember to apply the Species data label when submitting the issue.

If you do not want to register with GitHub, please contact aborja at azti.es or cjm at niva.dk. But, do please check first if the problem has already been noted.

Corrections will be gathered and used to update future versions of the species list. Remember that, while you are waiting for updated versions, you are free to use your own user-defined species lists, including any corrections you deem necessary.

If you are a GitHub user, you can also use the issue functionality to record issues.
